page.title: 09HOUSES IN OARE
page.content: The oldest house in Oare is the Old Oxyard, where the late Lady Hurd, mother of Douglas Hurd the present Home Secretary, used to live. It was built in the late 17th.century, or even earlier. Other houses, such as the Post Office have very old parts,but they have been rebuilt. The original part of Oare House is dated 1740. It was designed by Clough Williams Ellis whose work includes the village of Portmeirion in Wales. The first owner was Henry Deacon, a London Wine Merchant. In 1930 Sir Geoffrey Fry, who was Personal Secretary to Sir Stanley Baldwin, added wings to the main house. Much of the main village was built about the late seventeenth century.
